slides.title: Introduction to Women and Child Welfare
slides.content:
**Why This Topic is Crucial for Anganwadi Workers**

As an Anganwadi worker, you will directly work with:
- Women and mothers
- Children aged 0-6 years
- Community welfare programs

**Key Areas:**
- Women Empowerment
- Child Rights
- Government Schemes
- Social Welfare Programs

**Your Role:** Bridge between government welfare programs and beneficiaries.

slides.title: Constitutional Rights
slides.content:
**Fundamental Rights for Women and Children**

**Right to Equality (Article 14-18)**
- Equal treatment before law
- No discrimination based on gender

**Right to Freedom (Article 19-22)**
- Freedom of speech and expression

**Right Against Exploitation (Article 23-24)**
- Prohibition of child labour (below 14 years)
- No trafficking of women and children

**Right to Education (Article 21A)**
- Free and compulsory education for children 6-14 years

**Special Protections:**
- Article 39(e): Protection of children from exploitation
- Article 39(f): Healthy development of children
- Article 42: Maternity relief provisions

slides.title: Child Rights - UNCRC
slides.content:
**UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC)**

India ratified UNCRC in 1992

**Four Core Principles:**

**1. Non-Discrimination**
- All children have equal rights
- No discrimination based on caste, religion, gender

**2. Best Interests of Child**
- Child's welfare is paramount

**3. Right to Life, Survival and Development**
- Access to healthcare, nutrition, education

**4. Respect for Views of Child**
- Children have right to express their opinions

**Key Rights:**
- Right to name and nationality
- Right to protection from abuse
- Right to play and recreation
- Right to family environment

slides.title: Government Schemes for Women - Part 1
slides.content:
**Beti Bachao Beti Padhao**
- Launched: 22 January 2015
- Aim: Save girl child, educate girl child
- Focus on improving sex ratio and girls' education

**Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)**
- Cash benefit to pregnant and lactating mothers
- â‚¹5,000 in three installments
- For first living child

**Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana**
- Savings scheme for girl child
- For girls below 10 years
- High interest rate
- Tax benefits under Section 80C

**Mahila E-Haat**
- Online marketing platform for women entrepreneurs
- Direct buyers and sellers connect
- Supports women's economic empowerment

slides.title: Government Schemes for Women - Part 2
slides.content:
**One Stop Centre Scheme**
- Support for women affected by violence
- 24x7 helpline: 181
- Medical aid, legal aid, counselling

**Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana**
- Free LPG connections to BPL families
- Women are beneficiaries
- Promotes clean cooking fuel

**National Mission for Empowerment of Women**
- Convergence of women-centric schemes
- Capacity building
- Gender sensitization

**Mahila Shakti Kendra**
- Community participation for women empowerment
- Skill development
- Employment opportunities
- Awareness generation

slides.title: Government Schemes for Children
slides.content:
**Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)**
- Launched: 1975
- Largest outreach program for children
- Services through Anganwadi Centres

**Mid-Day Meal Scheme**
- Free lunch for school children (Class 1-8)
- Improves enrollment and nutrition

**National Creche Scheme**
- Day care facilities for children (0-6 years)
- For working mothers

**Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK)**
- Child health screening and early intervention
- Covers 4 Ds: Defects, Diseases, Deficiencies, Development delays

**Mission Vatsalya**
- Child protection and welfare
- Replaced Integrated Child Protection Scheme

slides.title: POCSO Act 2012
slides.content:
**Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act**

**Enacted:** 2012
**Purpose:** Protect children from sexual abuse and exploitation

**Key Provisions:**
- Child means person below 18 years
- Gender-neutral (protects all children)
- Mandatory reporting of offences
- Child-friendly procedures during trial
- Special courts for speedy trial

**Offences Covered:**
- Sexual assault
- Sexual harassment
- Pornography involving children

**Penalties:**
- Minimum 7 years to life imprisonment
- Death penalty in aggravated cases

**Reporting:** Any person who knows about abuse must report to police or Child Welfare Committee

slides.title: Prohibition of Child Marriage Act
slides.content:
**Child Marriage Prohibition Act, 2006**

**Legal Marriage Age:**
- Girls: 18 years (recently proposed to increase to 21)
- Boys: 21 years

**Key Provisions:**
- Child marriage is voidable (can be annulled)
- Punishment for conducting child marriage: 2 years imprisonment + fine
- Parents/guardians can be punished

**Child Marriage Prohibition Officer**
- Appointed by state government
- Prevents child marriages
- Creates awareness

**Effects of Child Marriage:**
- Health risks for young mothers
- Drop out from education
- Perpetuates poverty
- Violation of child rights

slides.title: Women Empowerment Initiatives
slides.content:
**National Commission for Women (NCW)**
- Statutory body established in 1992
- Reviews laws affecting women
- Investigates violations of women's rights
- Helpline: 7827-170-170

**Nirbhaya Fund**
- Established: 2013 (after Delhi gang-rape)
- Support projects for women's safety
- Funds emergency response systems, CCTV, etc.

**Domestic Violence Act, 2005**
- Protection from domestic violence
- Covers physical, emotional, economic abuse
- Right to residence
- Protection orders from court

**Maternity Benefit Act, 1961**
- 26 weeks paid maternity leave
- Extended to 12 weeks for adoptive mothers
- Employment protection during maternity

question.questionText: What is the legal minimum age of marriage for girls in India?
question.explanation: According to the Child Marriage Prohibition Act, 2006, the legal minimum age of marriage for girls is 18 years (recently proposed to increase to 21 years). For boys, it is 21 years.
